title: ISic000704. Funerary inscription of Gaius Iulius Eutychus
body:
Facsimile Images

D (is) M (anibus) s (acrum)
C (aius) Iulius Eutych-
us vixit an (nos) XXXX
uxor b (ene) mer (enti) fec (it)

Apparatus criticus

English translation

Sacred to the spirits of the underworld. Gaius Iulius Eutychus lived for 40 years. His wife made this for a well deserving man.

Italian translation

Consacrato agli Dei Mani | Caius Iulius Eutychus | Visse per 40 anni | La moglie pose per (il marito) meritevole

commentary

Whether Gaius Iulius Eutychus was a freedman (former slave) or freeborn we cannot tell, but the absence of a father’s name perhaps suggests the former. The Greek name Εὐτύχης (‘good fortune’) is very common, in Sicily and across the Greek world. The inscription follows a very standard form for Latin epitaphs.

bibliography

  • 1989.0341g https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283
  • 97 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
